intro: Corchorus brasiliensis, commonly known as Brazilian kochia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed areas and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are often pink or purple. Corchorus brasiliensis is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
